alert.note: Alert for Tehachapi (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 20 at 8:41AM PST until December 21 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Kern County mountains and the southern portions of the Coastal Range and San Joaquin Valley. * WHEN...Through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. Mud and rock slides will be possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The heaviest rain that could cause excessive runoff will fall this evening through Thursday evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
